Subjective: Trouble passing hard stools; infrequent bowel movements; abdominal pain and cramps; bloating; underweight; sensitive to touch on the bottom left abdomen. No blood in stool; no fever; no change in urination; regular periods. Concerned about cause of symptoms; wants to know if it's something serious; interested in making stools softer; interested in further help with weight management.
Objective: Abdomen: bloated, swollen, sensitive to touch on the bottom left; normal bowel sounds; varying tympani. No fever; normal urination; regular periods.
Assessment: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS); ruled out: ulcerative colitis, other serious conditions.
Plan: Prescribe psyllium fibre sachets to soften stool
Take fibre sachets with plenty of water every day for 6 weeks
Monitor for worsening abdominal pain, fever, or blood in stool
Consider referral to dietitian for weight management
